unit_learning_outcomes.description: Employ close reading skills and technical creative writing terms, vocabulary and narrative studies concepts to discuss and analyse craft and technique.
Produce the opening of a long-form narrative, either a novel or novella, and a book proposal.
Practice a range of methods of improvisation and drafting that support the creative development of the novel or novella.
Research and select potential publication or funding opportunities.
Collaborate in the analysis and discussion of the work of others in writing workshops.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading set texts and the creative work of peers in preparation for discussions, quizzes, and writing workshops.
In preparation for completion of the Book Proposal, undertake research of industry standard book proposals, publisher and literary agent and competition submission requirements.

enrolment_rules.description: 20 cp at 2000 level including ENGX2033 or ENGX233

assessments.description: Contribute to discussion and appraisal of readings and to workshop feedback to student peers.
Creative Work: opening 2,500 words to a novel or novella.

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit introduces students to long-form narrative writing in the genre of the novel and novella. Students apply their previous learning of narrative writing technique and craft to the creation and planning of a new work, focusing on creativity and inspiration, research and planning, drafting the plot outline, developing characters, and building the story-world. Students read and discuss novels and novellas from different genres, and are introduced to current industry practices and conditions. At the conclusion of this unit students will have produced the opening to a novel or novella, and a book proposal including a synopsis.
